title.narrative: IR 2. CHILD AND FAMILY WELFARE SYSTEM

description.narrative: By 2015, the most vulnerable and marginalized children and their families are better protected by a child and family welfare system., which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, children in the Lao PDR are protected against abuse, exploitation, violence, neglect and discrimination through the development of a legal, regulatory and social welfare system.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2015, the most vulnerable and marginalized children and their families are better protected by a child and family welfare system.

description.narrative: The preliminary report of the national survey on violence against children was launched and is providing Government with evidence based recommendations for the development of a national multi-sectoral prevention and response plan. | Status:Met | As-of Date:15/01/2017

title.narrative: % of provisions in the new Decree on Adoption which comply with the Hague Intercountry Adoption Convention (1993)

baseline.value: No Decree (only general provisions on Adoption in the Family Law and Adoption Guidelines)

target.value: 2014:Decree finalized with 80% compliance with the essential safeguards of the Hague Intercountry Adoption Convention (1993) (by 2014)

actual.value: 2016:The Adoption Decree was approved by Government and signed by the Prime Minister in June 2014. The new Decree complies with substantive provisions of the Hague Convention. The members of Adoption Committees benefited from the Orientations and training on adoption.

title.narrative: National Study on Violence against Children completed (availability of baseline), key findings and recommendations presented to policy makers and key stakeholders for child protection system strengthening

baseline.value: Partial: 76% children age 2-14 are subject to at least one form of psychological aggression or physical punishment from an adult in their household. No data on sexual VAC and VAC in other settings: co

actual.value: 2016:The study finalized. The preliminary findings of the survey were launched on 2 June 2016, the full report is awaiting for the approval from the government.

title.narrative: Assessment of the existing child and family welfare system completed (availability of baseline), findings and recommendations presented to the relevant sectors for child and family system strengthening

baseline.value: Partial: Social Welfare System in Lao PDR: An Analysis of Welfare Services for the Prevention and Response to Abuse, Violence, and Exploitation against Children (2009)

actual.value: 2016:The report has been finalized and endorsed by the Ministry of labor and Social Welfare.

title.narrative: The collection of data on violence exploitation and abuse in the country is available on an ad-hoc basis (including one off surveys)

actual.value: 2017:With UNICEF Lao PDR support, the first national survey on violence against children (VAC), covering physical, emotional and sexual violence was completed in 2016 to enhance the evidence to inform the future direction of the child protection system and programme planning for prevention and response t
